entry.def: A messy person or activity makes things dirty or untidy.

example.ex: She was a good, if messy, cook...
example.tran: 尽管不爱干净，她还是个好厨子。

example.ex: As the work tends to be a bit messy you'll need to wear old clothes.
example.tran: 这个活儿有点脏，你需要穿旧衣服。

entry.def: Something that is messy is dirty or untidy.

example.ex: Dad cooks when Mum is busy, he makes me clean up my messy room...
example.tran: 妈妈忙的时候爸爸做饭，他还让我清理我乱糟糟的房间。

example.ex: Don't worry if this first coat of paint looks messy.
example.tran: 如果这第一层油漆看上去很脏的话，不用担心。

entry.tran: (局面)混乱而复杂的，棘手的，难以应付的
entry.def: If you describe a situation as messy, you are emphasizing that it is confused or complicated, and therefore unsatisfactory.

example.ex: John had been through a messy divorce himself...
example.tran: 约翰自己也经历过一次十分棘手的离婚。

example.ex: Life is a messy and tangled business...
example.tran: 生活就是一件既混乱又复杂的事情。
